Loratadine Label (U.S.) Proposed by Sponsor
Loratadine Label (U.S.)
Proposed by Sponsor

Uses • relieves and reduces itching and rash due to recurring or chronic hives of an unknown source. • use only after being told by a doctor that you have recurring or chronic hives (chronic idiopathic urticaria).

Loratadine Label (U.S.) Proposed by Sponsor
Loratadine Label (U.S.)
Proposed by Sponsor

Uses • relieves and reduces itching and rash due to recurring or chronic hives of an unknown source; however, only use this product for itching and rash after being told by a doctor that you have recurring or chronic hives (chronic idiopathic urticaria).

CIU Self-Recognition and Label Comprehension Study
CIU Self-Recognition and
Label Comprehension Study

565 subjects
565 subjects

• Cohort 1: self-recognized CIU sufferers (N=196) • Cohort 2: general population (N=116) • Cohort 3: low literacy (N=96) • Cohort 4: pregnant/nursing, liver/kidney disease (N=114) • Cohort 5: acute hives sufferers (N=102)
• Cohort 1: self-recognized CIU sufferers (N=196)
• Cohort 2: general population (N=116)
• Cohort 3: low literacy (N=96)
• Cohort 4: pregnant/nursing, liver/kidney disease (N=114)
• Cohort 5: acute hives sufferers (N=102)

Label Comprehension Results
Label Comprehension Results

Based on the label, what is this product used for?
Based on the label, what is this product used for?

• 62% correct or acceptable response
• 62% correct or acceptable response

– 79% incorrect responses mentioned hives
– 79% incorrect responses mentioned hives

– Other incorrect responses: trouble
– Other incorrect responses: trouble

speaking/swallowing, drooling, food or medication allergy, fever, breathing problems
speaking/swallowing, drooling, food or
medication allergy, fever, breathing problems

Conclusion
Conclusion

• OTC oral antihistamines cannot be marketed currently for hives or CIU under monograph system
